key_points: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle pledge to reach net zero carbon emissions by 2030, a first in the royal family.
The announcement was made on their Archewell site, coinciding with the COP26 United Nations Climate Change Conference.
Archewell's commitment included previous efforts to offset and balance carbon footprint, now aiming for net zero with partner organizations.
Net zero carbon emissions involve reducing carbon footprint through thoughtful daily choices and investing in carbon removal projects.
The Sussexes' commitment includes rethinking travel and daily activities to minimize carbon emissions.
Partners advising Harry and Meghan include Travalyst and Ethic, focusing investments towards a low-carbon economy.
Since stepping back from royal duties in 2020, Harry and Meghan have been more vocal in political and environmental advocacy.
Meghan recently penned an open letter advocating for nationalized paid parental leave in the U.S.
The Sussexes' environmental push aligns with similar efforts by Prince William, Kate Middleton, and Prince Charles at COP26.
Prince William introduced Earthshot Prize Awards finalists at COP26, highlighting innovators working to repair the planet.
